courseDescription:
Working as a paralegal can be a great way to start a career in the UK's justice system. This course covers everything you need to know to stand out in a law office. It starts with an overview of the role of paralegals. You will explore who they are, the traits you need to develop to succeed and the opportunities available in this profession. You will also learn about the main paralegal functions and why they are essential to society.

The course then introduces key legal terms used by paralegals, professional roles in the legal workplace and key people in the legal sector. You will also learn about effective communication and how to use it in your daily work. Furthermore, you will explore the UK legal system and its legislative process. You will research business, property, estate and criminal law and their importance for paralegals. Understanding some of the legal matters you will face in this field is critical. We will explore family law, civil court proceedings, bankruptcy, insurance and personal injury claims.

The following section looks at the different categories of human rights and the international framework that protects them. You will also learn about the conduct and ethics of paralegals. The final section focuses on the skill and professional attitude you need to excel. So if you want to know how to take on significant responsibilities such as the legally enforceable groundwork for contracts and court cases, as well as expected duties and administrative support skills, sign up for this course today and expand your career opportunities.
